meanings.definition: A person employed to manage a household and perform domestic duties.
meanings.sent1: The housepersons kept the house clean and organized.
meanings.sent2: We hired housepersons to help with cooking and cleaning.
meanings.sent3: The housepersons accidentally mixed up the laundry and turned everything pink!
meanings.sent4: The housepersons were the unsung heroes of the household, keeping everything running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The housepersons worked tirelessly to ensure the household ran like a well-oiled machine.

meanings.definition: The plural form of houseperson, referring to multiple individuals performing household tasks.
meanings.sent1: Our family employs housepersons to help with various chores around the house.
meanings.sent2: The housepersons work together efficiently to complete all the household tasks.
meanings.sent3: The housepersons decided to have a friendly competition to see who could finish their tasks first.
meanings.sent4: In a bustling household, the housepersons were like busy worker bees, each with their own important role.
meanings.sent5: The housepersons formed a close-knit team, supporting each other in their daily duties.
